messages: 094ac25783446f3dbf535ae64dfaba95 (08:33): no, but i've got a bridge you can buy..
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (08:49): How does the display(int num) slot work for the QLCDNumber. It seems if I put an int in the parameter for an int, the display still displays 0.

76d6e941922cdc36614b64f5c1c37705 (09:10): model-view is just a design pattern
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:11): Cherry2000, can you help me?

42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:11): marcusU, ignore cherry2000, he's not exactly helpgul

e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:13): How does the display(int num) slot work for the QLCDNumber? It seems if I put an int in the parameter for an int, the display still displays 0.
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:13): Can you put your code in a pastebin?

e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:22): Is this a legal way to use a SLOT? SLOT(display(getIncrementValue()) ?
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:22): I would think so...don't think I've ever done it before, tho
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:23): QMario, if you connect it SLOT(getIncrementValue()) and then use getIncrementValue() to call display() does it work?
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:24): oh, and currently do you know if it /is/ calling getIncrementValue()?
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:24): Tmorton, connect what? What is "it"?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:24): QMario: Do you have a short snipplet that's compilable you can post?
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:25): MarcusU, no. It's in more than one file.
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:26): and then make getIncrementValue() call incrementLCD->display(whatever)
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:27): Sorry, I don't have a working qt4 in front of me at the moment
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:28): MarcusU, I can paste all my source code though.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:29): I don't know if you can put a function call inside the function the way that you're doing.
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:31): MarcusU, then how would that make sense.
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:31): err, sorry, what I meant was this:
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:31): If it says it needs an int, it should accept a function that returns an int.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:31): No, I don't think that you can do that.
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:32): and connect( incrementButton, SIGNAL(clicked()), incrementLCD, SLOT(display(++myValue)) );
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:32): MarcusU, then what can you do. It doesn't make sense that you can't set the LCD, value's private variable.
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:32): Tmorton, I tried it. It doesn't work.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:33): If QLCDNumber had a slot for increment(), you could use that.
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:33): I assume myValue is an int, right?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:34): The syntax for SLOT is basically SLOT(function(type_args)) where type_args is empty or a list of *types*.
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:36): MarcusU, why is it that way?
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:36): MarcusU, how does that work?
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:37): You're trying to insert an extra function call into the chain of events of signals and slots.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:37): The real problem is that QLCDNumber needs an increment() function/slot.
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:37): MarcusU, does it have one?
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:38): MarcusU, what have you done about that problem?
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:38): QMario, I think marcusU is right...after I read the docs
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:38): I stomped my feet and jumped up and down back in the Qt2.x days. It didn't help.
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:39): MarcusU, that is a ridiculous issue with that QWidget.
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (09:40): If you really want that behavior, subclass QLCDNumber and ignore an increment() slot.

42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (09:40): so QMario...I think the best thing to do would probably to connect clicked() to getIncrementValue() (make getIncrementValue() a slot) and then have getIncrementValue() call display(int)
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (09:47): Tmorton, how would I do that?
76d6e941922cdc36614b64f5c1c37705 (10:20): wow tmormon you really helped that guy out
